abstract: Protestors take to streets in Burundi after Pres Pierre Nkurunziza announces he will run for third term; three people are killed and 15 police officers injured in attempt to break up protest with tear gas and water cannons.
lead_paragraph: The police fired tear gas and water cannons on Monday at protesters who blocked roads with tires and large stones to show opposition to President Pierre Nkurunziza’s plan to run for a third term.

headline.main: Burundi: Police Try to Subdue Protesters Denouncing Leader’s Plan to Run Again
headline.print_headline: Africa; Burundi: Police Try to Subdue Protesters Denouncing Leader’s Plan to Run Again

snippet: The police fired tear gas and water cannons on Monday at protesters who blocked roads with tires and large stones to show opposition to President Pierre Nkurunziza’s plan to run for a third term.
